about.address: 346 Grimshaw Lane, Middleton Junction, Middleton, M24 2AU
about.hours:
Day | Hours
--- | ---
Monday | 8.30am - 6.30pm
Tuesday | 8.30am - 6.30pm
Wednesday | 8.30am - 6.30pm
Thursday | 8.30am - 1.30pm
Friday | 8.30am - 6.30pm
about.info: There has been a doctors surgery at 346 Grimshaw Lane for over a hundred years. The previous partners were Dr McHenry, Dr Wallace, Dr McKee and Dr McCrea. Dr Thomason replaced Dr McKee on his retirement in 1979 and Dr Martin started at the Practice in 1982. The Practice took over the surgery at Mount Road in the early 00’s and then moved up to the newly built Alkrington Health Centre in 2008. In 1979 the Practice of two partners had a patient list of 5500 people. It employed one morning receptionist and one evening receptionist, plus a cleaner.\n\nThe Junction and Alkrington Surgeries now have a patient list size of 8000+ people and employ 31 members of staff, plus several locum doctors. Our doctors, nurses, healthcare assistants, counsellors and receptionists all split their time between both sites (some work more at one than the other) whilst our admin staff are usually based at one location.

about.info: The Strand Medical Center is a friendly family run practice in the heart of Kirkholt. We offer many services such as stop smoking, holiday vaccinations, seasonal Flu vaccinations, children's immunizations, pre-school boosters and much more!

about.info: Welcome to our award winning practice offering high quality personal primary care for an increasing number of registered patients in Middleton and the surrounding area. For more information please visit the [practice website](http://www.drstocktonandthompson.co.uk)

about.info: Ashworth Street Surgery was formed in July 1999. There are six doctors who form the partnership: Drs Steve Doyle, Dave Osborne, Jenny Nelson, Shalini Gadiyar, Mark Mudalige and Adam Simmons. In addition to this we have a salaried GP, Dr Elizabeth Knott and a regular GP doing five sessions a week, Dr Kevin Cody, plus a number of training doctors, a nurse practitioner, practice nurses and health care assistants who compliment the team. There is also a large number of receptionists and administration staff who play a very important role in the everyday running of the practice.

about.hours:
Monday – Friday: 8.30am – 6.00pm

The surgery doors are open from 8am each morning (for collecting and dropping things off) but access to the building is via an Intercom on the front door. On Tuesday we offer extended hours until 9pm. This is for pre-booked Doctor appointments and again, access is via the intercom on the front door.
about.info: The practice is keen to keep abreast of any changes and we pride ourselves on keeping the whole team up to date with everything we do. For this reason, we close for team training on the 2nd Thursday of each month from 1-4pm. The practice re-opens for evening surgery etc at 4pm.

about.info: Yorkshire Street Surgery is a long established group practice. The premises were extended and refurbished in 1994 and this greatly improved the facilities available for our patients. All of patient services are available on the ground floor with easy access for wheelchair users and include disabled toilet facilities.

about.info: Dr Ghafoors Medical centre aims to provide a quality service to its patients promoted by the continous efforts of its Practitioners, Locums or Deputies, Management, Staff and any Health Authority or NHS staff attached to the practice. We operate a personal medical service and try to ensure continuity of care. Our practice is open Monday to Friday. Full practice nursing services, family planning, midwifery and child health care are available, and our deicated reception staff are trained to assist you in making the most of our many services.

about.info: Middleton Health Centre operates out of a modern purpose built unit which is located within Middleton Shopping Centre. The unit has facilities for those who may need assistance. There are disabled toilets, accessible seating, hearing aid loops and the health centre is all on one level. Within the shopping centre there is disabled parking available and lifts to each floor. We have a dedicated children’s waiting area to keep them entertained whilst waiting. We ask that parents supervise their children in the area whilst they are waiting. Within the children’s area there is also a section for women who may want to breast feed.
